div.l: Ther was no wight þᵗat durste hand on hym legge
But ȝif he swoor he shulde anon abegge
A theef he was for sothe of corn and mele
And þat a sleigh and vsant for to stele
His name was hoten deynous Symkyn
A wyf he hadde comen of noble kyn
The ꝑpersoıı̄un of the toıı̄un hir fader was
With hir he ȝaf ful many a panne of bras
For þat Symkyn sholde in his blood allie
She was yfostred in a Nonnerie
For Symkyn wolde no wyf as he saide
But she were wel ynorsshed and a maide
To sauen his estate of ȝomanrye
And she was proud and pert as is a pye
A ful faire sighte was it vpon hem two
On halidayes biforn hir wolde go
With his tipet wounden a boute his heed
And she cam after in a gyte of reed
And Symkyn hadde hosen of þe same
Ther durst no wight clepen hir but dame
Was noon so hardy þat wente by þe way
That with hire dorste rage or ones play
But ȝif he wolde be slayn of Symkyn
With panade or with knyf or boydekyn
For Ialous folk been ꝑperilous eủere mo
Algate they wolde hir wyues wende so
And eek for she was somdel smot̉erliche
She was as digne as water in a diche
And ful of hoker and of bismare
Hir thoughte þat a lady sholde hire spare
What for hir kynrede and hir nortelrie
That she hadde lerned in þe Nonnerie
A doughter hadde they bitwixe hem two
Of twenty yere withoute eny mo
Sauynge a childe þᵗat was of hal ȝere age
In cradel it lay and was a proper page
This wenche thikke / and wel ygrowen was
With camuse nose / and eyen graye as glas
With buttokꝭes brode ⁊and breestes rounde and hye
